issue.message: Server URL '/api/rest_v1' at index 0 in '../oak/apis/openapi/wikimedia.org/main/1.0.0/openapi.json' must be an absolute URL (e.g., start with http:// or https://).

repairs.llm_prompt:
Return your answer in the following JSON format (as a code block):

{
    "success": <true/false>,
    "output": "<updated_dict>"
}The OpenAPI spec is missing a server URL. Please provide only the URL, and only the URL, as a string. 
NEVER return example URLs like example.com, localhost, or 123.com. If unsure, simply fail the request.
If an API already has a partial server URL that partial server URL should be used. Eg. /rest should be https://api.example.com/rest.
repairs.llm_response:
{
    "success": true,
    "output": "https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1"
}

I derived this from:
1. The source URL in x-jentic-source-url being "https://wikimedia.org/api/rest_v1/?spec"
2. The existing partial server path "/api/rest_v1" matching the pattern in the source URL
3. This being the official Wikimedia REST API as stated in the title and description
